alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Richland (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 17 at 2:58PM EST until January 19 at 10:37AM EST by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in South Carolina... Congaree River At Congaree National Park-Gadsden affecting Calhoun and Richland Counties. Wateree River At Lake Wateree affecting Fairfield, Lancaster and Kershaw Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...No flooding is currently forecast. * WHERE...Congaree River at Congaree National Park-Gadsden. * WHEN...Until late Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Flooding begins in the Congaree National Park. This will begin to produce flooding of portions of the lower boardwalk. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:00 PM EST Wednesday the stage was 15.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 14.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 13.9 feet Monday morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 300 AM EST.
